The effort it takes to make something appear simple is quite ridiculous. I think my head can't contort into clear ideas at 1:45am...
I think the coffee shop I'm in makes the chairs uncomfortable on purpose, so people like me don't have an incentive to stay for hours...
Is it possible to force creativity?  Must come up with draft agenda for a big event in the next hour.
We need a better system for dealing with business cards after conferences.
Loving the time difference.  I can do lots of work with no distraction before DC wakes up.
Just read Bruce Mau's "Incomplete Manifesto" and "12 Strategies of Design Methodology."  Fascinating.  Google it, it will inspire you.
Hoping that my train doesn't get delayed tomorrow.  London is going to be a madhouse with the G-20 crowds.
Jill Sobule's music and latest album, "California," is amazing.  Reminds me of writing funding proposals till 1am at Sea Ranch.
Next up, figure out how to write a blog.  Social media is coming at me hard and fast.  A whole new world.
Press releases are not that difficult when you have a template.  A first for everything...
In a coffee shop in London, trying to catch up on a week's worth of email.  The worst part of going to a conference!
